1. It slows down the pace of the breath which is said to improve the longevity of the life. 

2. It cleanses as well as refreshes the Nadis which are subtle channels of the body. 

3. It promotes mental clarity along with focus. 

4. It is quite beneficial in enhancing memory. 

5. It also improves skin color and its complexion. 

6. It soothes and rejuvenates the nervous system. 

7. It also promotes sound sleep. 

8. This pranayama fosters a profound sense of relaxation as well as calmness in the mind and the body. 

9. It infuses the mind and the body with fresh prana, which is the vital life force. 

10. The additional benefits of this pranayama include, relief of sinus pressure, diminished pain due to headaches and strengthening of the digestive as well as nervous systems. 

11. Research suggests that Ujjayi pranayama and Shavasana decrease HR, SP.

1. People who are suffering from any heart disease and high blood pressure shouldn’t combine Bandha and breathe retention in this pranayama. 

2. In case you feel dizzy then stop practicing this pranayama immediately and start normal breathing. 

3. Don’t tighten your throat during this pranayama. 

4. The proportion of breathing shouldn’t be forced under any circumstances. 

5. Breathing should always be steady as well as smooth and rhythmic.
